awd_titl_txt: Symposium on Atomic Spectroscopy and Highly-Ionized Atoms;  Lisle, Illinois; August l6-2l, l987 (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: The Symposium on Atomic Spectroscopy and Highly-Ionized                 Atoms brings together two important international conferences.                  The first-the Symposium on Atomic Spectroscopy-has been held                    quadriennally for some decades.  It focusses on the well-defined                field of atomic energy levels.  The second-the more recently                    organized Conference on Highly-Ionized Atoms-deals with the new                 topic of the properties of atoms with most of their orbital                     electrons removed so they are isoelectronic with the simplest                   atoms.  The merging of these two conferences promises to provide                a meeting ground for the exchange of new ideas in a broad range                 of atomic physics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
